column1: McCain is opposed to federal funding of Amtrak. He considers it to be a pork barrel project"
column2: particularly as far as longer distance trains are concerned.[69][70] He has also argued for more stringent safety standards with respect to cars.[71]"

column3: Supports increased funding for public transit using alternative fuel technologies.[72]
column4: Nader was instrumental in the unanimous passage of the 1966 National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act.[73]

column1: In October 2006, McCain said that he believed the former President Bill Clinton and his administration were to blame for the North Korea's weapons of mass destruction. He said that the U.S. had concluded an unenforceable and untransparent agreement"
column2: allowing North Korea to keep plutonium rods in a reactor.[115]"
